details.description: Check a vehicle's details on the Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency (DVLA) database
details.more_information:
You'll need to know the make of the vehicle and its registration number.

##Information you can get

You can find out various things about the vehicle, including:

- when its current tax disc is due to expire
- the date a SORN is due to expire
- the date it was first registered
- colour
- engine size 
- year of manufacture
- CO2 emissions
- current vehicle tax rate

If you want to get information about the [current or previous registered keeper of a vehicle](/get-vehicle-information-from-dvla/other-ways-to-apply "other ways to apply"), you'll have to do so in writing.


*[SORN]: statutory off road notification
details.introduction:
You can check online to find out what information the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) holds about a vehicle. 

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
details.alternate_methods:
##Get details about a vehicle's registered keeper

You can request the name and address of the registered keeper of another vehicle if you can show that you have ‘reasonable cause’ for needing the information. This can include:

* finding out who was responsible for an accident
* tracing the owner of an abandoned vehicle
* issuing penalty tickets
* tracing people responsible for driving off without paying for goods and services
* tracing vehicle owners suspected of insurance fraud

You can ask for:

* details of a vehicle’s registered keeper
* information about previous keepers for a vehicle now registered in your name
* information the DVLA holds about you 

You'll have to fill in a form and apply by post. The form you need to use depends on who is making the request, and why.

$D
[Download ‘Request for information (V888) - members of the public' (PDF, 188K)](http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20080814090248/http://direct.gov.uk/en/Motoring/OwningAVehicle/AdviceOnKeepingYourVehicle/DG_4022067?IdcService=GET_FILE&dID=51951&Rendition=Web "Download 'Request for information (V888) - members of the public' (PDF, 188K)"){:rel="external"}
$D

$D
[Download ‘Request for information (V888/2) - companies (all circumstances where no penalty charge notice issued)' (PDF, 157K)](http://origin.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065258.pdf "Download ‘Request for information (V888/2) - companies (all circumstances where no penalty charge notice issued)' (PDF, 157K)"){:rel="external"}
$D

$D
[Download ‘Request for information (V888/3) - companies (only where a penalty charge notice will be issued)' (PDF, 184K)](http://origin.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065259.pdf "Download ‘Request for information (V888/3) - companies (only where a penalty charge notice will be issued)' (PDF, 184K)"){:rel="external"}
$D

Read 'Giving people information from our vehicle record' for more information on requesting information from DVLA records.

$D
[Download 'Giving people information from our vehicle  record' (PDF,1.38MB)](http://origin.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_193598.pdf "Download 'Giving people information from our vehicle  record (PDF, 1.38 MB)"){:rel="external"}
$D


##Enquiries by phone

You can also make a vehicle check by telephone to get details of the vehicle's:

- date of first registration
- year of manufacture
- engine size
- CO2 emissions
- colour
- current vehicle tax rate

To make a vehicle check by phone, call the DVLA Vehicle Check Helpline.

$C
**DVLA Vehicle Check Helpline**  
0906 185 8585  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm   
Saturday, 8am to 2pm   
Calls are charged at 51 pence per minute
$C

You can also find out the expiry date of the vehicle's current tax disc by calling the DVLA Date of Liability Check Helpine.

$C
**DVLA Date of Liability Check Helpline**  
0906 765 7585  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm   
Calls are charged at 51 pence per minute
$C


DVLA also provides certain companies with the 'bulk data set', which contains 47 different information fields about a vehicle. These companies can provide a vehicle checking service to the public and the motor trade. More information is in the leaflet below.

$D
[Download 'Bulk data brochure' (PDF, 170KB)](http://www.dft.gov.uk/dvla/~/media/pdf/other/V995X1_080411_Bulk "Download 'Bulk data brochure' (PDF, 170KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D




*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[CO2]: carbon dioxide
*[SORN]: statutory off road notification
